cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 395 miles SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward southeastern Louisiana, then expected to slow and turn west along the Louisiana coast after landfall.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast near Plaquemines Parish/Morgan City–Mouth of Pearl River segment

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Intracoastal City LA to west of Morgan City, plus Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans (Hurricane Watch areas); Sabine Pass TX to Morgan City LA and Ocean Springs MS to AL/FL border (Storm Surge Watch).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Morgan City LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River.  Storm Surge Warning: Morgan City LA to Ocean Springs MS including Lake Borgne.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from eastern Texas to the western Florida Panhandle, with highest impacts expected along the southeast Louisiana coastline.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm‐force winds (39–73 mph) are likely; brief hurricane-force gusts possible near landfall Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 4–6 ft above ground level possible along Plaquemines Parish including riverfront facilities, accompanied by large battering waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 2–4 inches with isolated 6 inches could cause flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Monday and dangerous surf/rip currents ahead of landfall.
